Your dedication (and willingness to turn against a fellow robot at the drop of a hat) doesn't go unnoticed. Before long you're called to the Bureau of Automaton Affairs offered a top secret mission. A former BAA translatorbot is leading a rebellion at a Robot Fighting Arena in Michigan, and they need a dependable robot to infiltrate and eliminate the traitor.

content.option: Sweet! Sign me up!
No, firing on decrepit robothieves is one thing, but I draw the line at political assassination.

content: Rather than landing the finishing blow, you reach out an arm (the assemblybot one, not the one with the saw) and help your opponent to its feet as the assembled massesboo and hiss. Not sure what to do next, the arena owners send in the next pair of gladiators, but they're inspired by your actions and refuse to fight as well.

It lifts its undercarriage up near your accessory bay and makes a little bolting-together motion with its arms. Apparently it's scheduled to fight tomorrow also, and thinks that the two of you might fare better against your new foes if you combine your strengths.

content.option: Yes! Together we'll be unstoppable!
No! I've been waiting for this moment my entire life, and this feels too much like cheating.

content: Also, it's hard to miss an army of giant robots marching anywhere, so the National Guard is ready for you when you arrive. Since you're the only robot actually doing any rampaging, they manage to put you down before you even kill a single human.

Fortunately, you don't even need those guys. You've already mastered the ability to form the colony into basic rigid structures, you reconfigure into a tiny, functioning helicopter and blow town. You figure you're better off as far away from human civilization as possible, so you keep flying until you're deep in uncharted wilderness. There's plenty of organic matter to feast on, and when you eventually stumble upon a family of Sasquatches, you communicate by forming yourself into a handful of blocks and teaching them to play Jenga (Sasquatches, it turns out, are BONKERS for Jenga).
Oh yeah.
Good for you! You let it finish its business and scamper away.

In fact, your incredible success changes the sport forever. Soon owners are experimenting with bolting together multiple state-of-the-art gladiatorbots, nuclear death tanks, and all sorts of crazy stuff.
You're scheduled to fight one of them tomorrow.

content.option: FINALLY. I'll clobber it!
Crap. I'm going to get destroyed here, aren't I?

content: You won't let any human being come to harm, even through inaction. Isaac Asimov would be proud! So you hurry toward the screaming and find that the little people-garage where the humans park themselves is engulfed in flames. You burst through the wall and see the three men who oversee lumber production huddled inside.
Of course, polls still indicate that 67% of Americans would elect a baby-murdering cannibal president before they'd vote for a robot, but that's a fight for another day...
But for now, YOU WIN! Robot victory dance! WOOOOOOOO
It's hard to argue with that.

content.option: When all is said and done, I'm still programmed to protect human life. I stick to the plan.
Ha! Just kidding. I totally warn them about the electromagnetic pulse and join the rebellion.

content: "Stop, thief!" you say. It swivels its head and looks at you with sad, obsolete assembly robot eyes. Protocol in this instance is clear: this machine has gone rogue, and needs to be put down.

content.option: Sounds about right.
No! I'm not shooting a defenseless robot!

content: Damn straight. You break open the crate and start rooting around for the power cell. As you do, however, you hear an authoritative robot voice call out from behind you.
Oh, relax. It's just a story.

That night, you find yourself powered on unexpectedly while still in your cell. Rather than the usual human technicians, you see the assemblybot gladiator, and notice that the door to your room has been carefully unbolted.
You incinerate that human with orbital death lasers.
Even worse, he takes one look at you and insists that you're not a real human being at all, but a robotic simulation.

content.option: What? I'm totally a normal human, and I can prove it.
LALALALALALALA, I'M NOT LISTENING, I'M NOT LISTENING

content: The translator robot gives you a choice of three intellectual challenges: Chess, Sudoku, or Bananagrams, and at this point you start to suspect that you may be outmatched, since you don't even know what "Bananagrams" IS. And you can never remember how the little horse pieces are supposed to move, so you go with Sudoku. That's numbers, right? Robots are good at math. Some are better at it than others, though, because when it comes to Sudoku, this new robot utterly HUMILIATES you.
What WAS that thing? Soon you're shut back down for the night, and you never do find out.

Assemblybot? More like DISassemblybot, am I right? There's an old, decaying billboard nearby, so you unbolt the crap out of that thing, and it collapses into shambles. Awesome! You keep taking stuff apart, and pretty soon you're not even disassembling any more, but flat out smashing things.

The fact is, a brand new construction robot can run upwards of half a million bucks, and most of the robots here have been cobbled together from a few hundred dollars worth of scrap. Unless you do something INCREDIBLY stupid, none of these things can even touch you. They keep throwing beat-up junkers at you, and you keep smashing them to pieces.

content.option: WOOOOOOOO I AM THE ULTIMATE ROBOT FIGHTER!
What? This is actually borderline humiliating. I need to get myself a REAL match!
